term.longtitle: IUPAC Gold Book - coal-derived pitch coke
term.title: coal-derived pitch coke

item.text: The primary industrial solid carbonization product obtained from coal tar pitch mainly produced in chamber or delayed coking processes.

notes.item: Coal-derived pitchcoke, although it exhibits a pregraphitic microstructure, has often a lower graphitizability than petroleum coke. Fractions of coal tar pitches (obtained by extraction or filtration) may form cokes with needle-like structures and have an improved graphitizability. The usually lower graphitizability compared to petroleum coke is due to an inhibition of mesophase growth because of chemical and physical differences of the cokes.
